paper_abstract: A family of kernel methods, based on the gamma-filter structure, is presented for non-linear system identification and time series prediction. The kernel trick allows us to develop the natural non-linear extension of the (linear) support vector machine (SVM) gamma-filter [G. Camps-Valls, M. Martinez-Ramon, J.L. Rojo-Alvarez, E. Soria-Olivas, Robust gamma-filter using support vector machines, Neurocomput. J. 62(12) (2004) 493-499.], but this approach yields a rigid system model without non-linear cross relation between time-scales. Several functional analysis properties allow us to develop a full, principled family of kernel gamma-filters. The improved performance in several application examples suggests that a more appropriate representation of signal states is achieved. (C) 2008 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Learning non-linear time-scales with kernel gamma-filters
